bill_title: opposing an initiated measure to place the right to an abortion in the Constitution of South Dakota.

bill_versions.bill_text: A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, opposing an initiated measure to place the right to an abortion in the Constitution of South Dakota. WHEREAS, the right to life is the most basic and fundamental human right; and WHEREAS, the protection of human life is a principal duty of any government; and WHEREAS, an initiated amendment to the Constitution of South Dakota may appear on the ballot in November 2024 and, if passed, will enshrine in the Constitution the right to an abortion; and WHEREAS, the proposed amendment to the Constitution would permit the termination of a human life, at any stage of pregnancy, including when the child is able to survive outside of the womb; and WHEREAS, the proposed amendment to the Constitution would eliminate a host of statutory provisions that were enacted for the safety and well-being of the pregnant woman and her child; and WHEREAS, the proposed amendment to the Constitution would override existing conscience protections that were enacted for healthcare providers; and WHEREAS, the proposed amendment to the Constitution would negatively impact parental rights; and WHEREAS, the proposed amendment to the Constitution would severely restrict any future enactment of protections for a pregnant woman, her child, and her healthcare providers: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the House of Representatives of the Ninety-Ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, the Senate concurring therein, that the proposed amendment to the Constitution would fail to protect human life, would fail to protect a pregnant woman, and would fail to protect the child she bears.
